title: OpenChain Self Certification
welcome_content: The OpenChain Specification identifies the key requirements of a quality open source compliance program. OpenChain Conformance allows organizations to show they meet these requirements. You can use this online questionnaire for free self-certification. You can also use this questionnaire for internal health checks. Your progress and results are private until you choose to submit them for publication.
Getting Started_content: Applicants confirm their understanding of the OpenChain Specification and the need to complete Self-Certification to become OpenChain Conformant. The Online Self-Certification requires you to:
Getting Started_content_3: Keep a record of how you met the requirements.
Learn More_content: You can get more details about OpenChain Self-Certification here.
offline-conformance-pdf: You can get the self-certification questionnaire in a printable and sharable format. You can download that here.
error-msg: Sorry - there was a problem loading data:
verify-username: You have not verified the username.  Would you like to resend a verify email to the email address you registered?
Please contact: Please contact OpenChain Support to report any inaccuracies or issues.

COMMENT_4: /********TRANSLATIONS FOR THE CONFIRMING PAGE IS GIVEN BELOW********* (Specification) ********************/
Conforming Organizations_content: The following organizations have self-certified conformance to the OpenChain Specification.
Length of password must be between 8 and: Length of password must be between 8 and 60.
Length of username must be between 3 and: Length of username must be between 3 and 40.
Username may consist of a-z, 0-9, unders: Username may consist of a-z, 0-9, underscores, spaces and must begin with a letter.

reset_Questionnaire_content: This will delete all answers and start a new Questionnaire with the latest Questionnaire version.  Are you sure you want to continue?
submission-notice: Thank you - your information has been submitted
confirm-submit-subdialog1: Your answers to the Conformance Self-Certification Questionnaire are accurate and verifiable.
confirm-submit-subdialog2: Your answers reflect your adherence to the OpenChain Specification.

COMMENT_12: /****************************** TRANSLATIONS FOR PASSWORD RESET INVALID PAGE IS GIVEN BELOW************************************/
Password-reset-invalid-content: The password reset link is either invalid or expired.  You can try resetting the password again or contact the OpenChain team for assistance.
COMMENT_13: /****************************** TRANSLATIONS FOR PASSWORD RESET REQUEST PAGE IS GIVEN BELOW************************************/
Password-reset-request-content: An email with a link to reset your password has been sent.  If you do not see the email, please check your junk email folder.  The link will expire in 24 hours.
COMMENT_14: /****************************** TRANSLATIONS FOR PASSWORD RESET SUCCESS PAGE IS GIVEN BELOW************************************/
Password-reset-success-content: An email with a link to reset your password has been sent.  If you do not see the email, please check your junk email folder.  The link will expire in 24 hours.
COMMENT_15: /****************************** TRANSLATIONS FOR REGISTRATION SUCCESS PAGE IS GIVEN BELOW************************************/
Reg-success-content: You are now successfully registered.  Please login using the menu above to continue to the self certification.
COMMENT_16: /****************************** TRANSLATIONS FOR REGISTRATION FAILED PAGE IS GIVEN BELOW************************************/
Reg-failed-content: Something seems to have gone wrong in the registration. The registration may have expired. Please contact the OpenChain team for additional help.
signup-success-content: You should receive an email from no-reply@conformance.openchainproject.org sent to the email specified in the sign-up form. Click on the link provided to complete the registration process. If you do not receive an email, check your spam folder and add no-reply@conformance.openchainproject.org to your trusted email list.
